text: I'll never forget the hype I had for this game and how much it delivered on it. I remember watching the first gameplay video and hearing this theme kick off in the beginning, and just being blown away by the sound quality compared to the GBA. The two Sorrow games are top notch.
author: SupraDarky

text: Are you me? I also remember seeing the first gameplay trailer on gametrailers and this song kicking off while Soma walked on the village. Man those were the days.
author: Godam_or

text: Indeed they are.  What a great way to start on DS era.

text: you're not worried about Coppa striking you're channel?
author: The Precious Little White Angel

text: Same here.  I was really excited when the E3 trailer was posted and this song kicked in and I had to have the game.  I mean, I would have anyway because IGA Castlevania, but after the GBA games this music was a revelation.  Drawing the glyphs was a PITA but the rest of the game was great.

text: Only a minute and a half.  Shame.  Welp, I'd better stop typing before Youtube takes me to the next video...
author: Stewie G

text:
I prefer Portrait, physically and aurally.

I was kinda underwhelmed by this after Aria because I felt like Aria got by on its own merits whereas DoS relied a lot on SotN nostalgia. I also wasn't crazy about this OST. Idk why but a lot of the music sounded like it was from Sailor Moon or something.

But then Portrait came through with that leg drop.

text: Is this one worth going back and playing?
author: Kakashi Hatake

text: Hell yeah
author: Gaming will NEVER be good again

text:
I think I've spent over 200 hours on this game. Didn't get to finish my 999% run, though.
A 999% run, of course, being obtaining 9 of every soul and item. Which, due to how the one-handed sword upgrade path works, requires a minimum of 27 full playthroughs.

text: I love the soundtrack of this game uwu

author: Konata Izumi

text: Really like this track. I need to get back into this game because I got lost not soon after this level haha.
author: NSXTypeRGTRLM

text: I dunno, I didn't enjoy Dawn of Sorrow very much. Aria of Sorrow quickly became my favorite Metroidvania when it released, but I feel like Dawn really let me down as a proper sequel. The other two DS Metroidvanias were top notch and I replayed them several times. I could only stomach one Dawn playthrough, even though Aria may have been my most played GBA game.
author: genesisSOC

text: Dawn is kinda jank. The luck stat doing nothing, needing to use boss souls to make the best weapons, being able to sequence break it with ease, the final areas being a real mess visually. Aria had a way stronger castle design and getting souls wasn't a chore, especially with the ring.

text: Soma 4 smash
author: Eddie Crompton

text: One of my favorite beginning tracks - sets such a good mood, now it's become very nostalgic too. I recently replayed DoS and it holds up very well. I played Portrait of Ruin shortly before and it couldn't compare imo. The only thing DoS is missing for perfection is Ayami Kojima's character art.

author: lazy bacon

text: Everything in this game built so well on the first (with the sole exception being the glyphs you had to draw to finish off a boss). The best addition has to be the Soul Fusion mechanic, where you used souls on weapons to evolve them, advacing down branching paths and reaching the ultimate form. It really encourages the player to choose between a powerful ability or a stronger weapon.

text: IMO, Dawn of Sorrow is the best game ever made for the DS.
